title: Hezbollah fires dozens of rockets at Israel after assassination in Deir Kifa
message:
Hezbollah said it fired dozens of rockets into northern Israel Thursday in retaliation for a deadly strike in south Lebanon, a day after a fiery speech from the group's leader.
Hezbollah on Thursday said that "in response to the assassination that the Israeli enemy carried out in the village of Deir Kifa," fighters targeted an Israeli barracks in Zar’it "with dozens of Katyusha rockets."
Lebanon's official National News Agency had reported one dead after an "enemy drone" struck a vehicle in south Lebanon's Deir Kifa area.
A source close to the group, requesting anonymity, told AFP he was killed in the Deir Kifa strike.
Lebanon’s National News Agency said that airstrike targeted the Bir Kallab area in Iqlim al-Tuffah's heights, deep in south Lebanon, as artillery shelling hit Khiam, Kfarkela and al-Ezziyeh.
event_breakdown:
Security event: Hezbollah fires rockets into northern Israel
Hezbollah said it fired dozens of rockets into northern Israel Thursday in retaliation for a deadly strike in Lebanon.

title: Hezbollah targets Israeli outpost in response to attack on southern Lebanon
message:
The Lebanese resistance movement Hezbollah has fired dozens of projectiles into the northern occupied territories in retaliation for an Israeli attack in southern Lebanon.
In a statement on Thursday, Hezbollah said its fighters targeted an Israeli barracks with "dozens of Katyusha rockets”.
It said the attack was carried out in response to the assassination of one of its fighters in an Israeli strike in the village of Deir Kifa earlier in the day.
Hezbollah has been carrying out almost daily rocket attacks on Israeli positions in retaliation for the regime’s aggression against Lebanon and in response to the ongoing Israeli onslaught against Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.
Two Israeli wars waged against Lebanon in 2000 and 2006 were met with strong resistance from Hezbollah, resulting in the retreat of the regime in both conflicts.
event_breakdown:
Israeli attack in southern Lebanon, Hezbollah retaliates with rockets
A Hezbollah fighter was assassinated by the Israeli military in an attack in Deir Kifa, a village located in southern Lebanon. Hezbollah fighters retaliated by targeting an Israeli barracks with "dozens of Katyusha rockets",  which was  fired and directed by Hezbollah from its suspected positions  (field) in northern occupied territories.

title: Moment  Houthi drone slam into enormous 750ft cargo ship sparking deadly explosion before vessel sank in latest attack in the Red Sea
message:
A 750ft cargo ship has sunk in the Red Sea days after Yemen's Houthi rebels said they launched a blistering drone attack on the vessel, reportedly killing one mariner on board.
It would be the second ship sunk as part of the rebels' campaign targeting Red Sea shipping after the Rubymar, which was carrying more than 41,000 tonnes of fertiliser, went down in March around two weeks after being struck by missiles.
In March, the Belize-flagged Rubymar carrying fertilizer cargo sank in the Red Sea after taking on water for days following a rebel attack.
A recent report by the US Defense Intelligence Agency said that container shipping through the Red Sea has declined by 90 per cent since December because of the attacks.
It also claimed destroying two Houthi drone boats in the Red Sea as well over the last 24 hours.
location: The main focus of the event is in the Red Sea.
event_breakdown:
Target event: Sinking of 750ft cargo ship in the Red Sea
More recent reports have claimed that a 750ft cargo ship has sunk in the Red Sea last week, weeks after Yemen's Houthi rebels said they launched a blistering drone attack on the vessel. The attacks are targeting the shipping industry.

title: Ukraine Neptune Missiles Are Homegrown Answer to ATACMS Restrictions
message:
Ukraine faces restrictions on using US-made, long-range missiles to strike targets inside Russia.
Ukraine has used this weapon to strike energy facilities inside Russia in recent weeks.
AdvertisementThe US has outfitted Ukraine with an arsenal of long-range missiles but continues to put restrictions on how it can use them, limiting its ability to strike Russia the way it wants.
As a workaround in this dilemma, Kyiv has turned to a homemade weapon first used to sink ships.
American-made MGM-140 Army Tactical Missile Systems, also known as ATACMS, are one of the more vaunted weapons that Ukraine has in its arsenal.

title: CENTCOM : US Airstrike In Syria Kills Senior ISIS Militant
message:
(MENAFN- Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)) WASHINGTON, June 19 (KUNA) - The US Central Command said Wednesday that its forces have killed a senior Islamic State group in an in Syria early this week.
In a press statement, the CENTCOM announced that it had conducted an airstrike in Syria on June 16, killing Usamah Jamal Muhammad Ibrahim al-Janabi, a senior official and facilitator.
"His death will disrupt ISIS's ability to resource and conduct terror attacks," reads the statement.
It vowed that it, alongside allies and partners in the region, will continue to execute operations to degrade ISIS operational capabilities and ensure its enduring defeat.
It affirmed that there is no indication any civilians were harmed in this strike.
event_breakdown: Usamah Jamal Muhammad Ibrahim al-Janabi, a senior official and facilitator of the Islamic State (ISIS), was killed in Syria in June 16 by a US forces led airstrike.

title: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah warns Israel about the cost of a war in Lebanon
message:
BEIRUT — As fighting along the Lebanese-Israeli border escalates, Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah is warning Israel that if the conflict were to slide into war, Israeli forces would face a much more powerful enemy than in the past.
Nasrallah as well repeated that Hezbollah did not want war, but that the current fighting risked sliding into a much wider battle.
Nasrallah said that in previous wars with Israel, Hezbollah had only hoped of being able to strike Israel’s Meron air base — the center for its northern Israel operations command.
Hezbollah fought another war with Israel in 2006.
Nasrallah said Cyprus allowing its bases to be used to target Lebanon would make it “part of the war, and the resistance will deal with it as part of the war."
event_breakdown: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Nasrallah warned that the current round of violence in Lebanon’s southern borders with Israel could slide into war.

Israel launches air strikes near Damascus
On Wednesday, Israel launched airstrikes on the outskirts of Damascus, Syria, reportedly targeting sites associated with Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) and the Lebanese terror group Hezbollah. The strikes were in retaliation for earlier IRGC rocket and drone attacks on an area near the contested Golan Heights—which is claimed by both Israel and Syria—that were aimed at Israeli military sites. No Israelis were killed, but five Syrian soldiers were killed in one of the retaliatory strikes. Once again, Israel has warned Hezbollah and its allies not to continue such attacks, saying any future provocations will “bring about a full-scale war.” As of midday Thursday, Israeli military spokesman Lieutenant-Colonel Avichay Adraee said the Lebanese terror group had “retreated” from the border area in southern Lebanon and the IDF saw “no exceptionally unusual events.”
Israeli military officials claim some 10 rockets were fired from the Syrian side of the Golan and toward Israeli positions on Wednesday night, along with a drone that “didn’t cross the border.” In response to the attack, which the IDF saw as a “substantial threat,” Israeli munitions struck both Syrian and Iranian targets, destroying Iranian intelligence facilities, training camps, observation posts, weapons depots, and Syrian anti-aircraft units south of Damascus. Col. Adraee said jets also flew over the Golan Heights on their way into Syria. title: Israeli tanks push into Rafah
message:
(Reuters-Yonhap)CAIRO -- Israeli tanks backed by warplanes and drones advanced deeper into the western part of the Gaza Strip city of Rafah on Wednesday, killing eight people, according to residents and Palestinian medics.
They did not identify the fatalities, and the Israeli military said it was looking into the report.
The Israeli military remained in control of the border between Rafah and Egypt.
The Israeli military said aid into Gaza had not been impeded by the damage.
Later Wednesday, Palestinian gunmen fired rockets at the Kerem Shalom crossing in southern Gaza, the Israeli military said.

title: Ukrainian power plant damaged in Russian attack : statement
message:
KYIV, Ukraine, June 20, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - A Ukrainian power plant was struck in an overnight Russian attack, the plant's operator said Thursday, in the latest missile and drone barrage targeting Ukrainian energy facilities.
The Russians attacked one of DTEK's thermal power plants," the company said in a statement, adding that an attack caused "serious damage" and wounded three employees.
It said this was the seventh "mass" attack on Ukrainian power plants over the last three months.
"Equipment at facilities in Vinnytsia, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Kyiv regions got damaged," it added, though the extent was still "being clarified".
It said air defence systems were also activated in the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Donetsk, Kherson, Kharkiv and Kyiv, among others.

title: No place  in Israel would be spared : Fears grow for all - out war after Hezbollah threatens Israel
message:
There are fears of all out war between Israel and Lebanon.
Hezbollah on Wednesday said none of Israel would be spared in a war, after Israel said it had approved plans for a Lebanon offensive, stoking fears of the Gaza conflict spreading.
Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah said "no place" in Israel would "be spared our rockets", in a televised address broadcast amid spiralling tensions across the Israel-Lebanon border.
Fears that Israel might launch a full-blown war in Lebanon have spiked, with the Israeli military on Tuesday announcing that "operational plans for an offensive in Lebanon were approved and validated".
Israel said the Hezbollah attack caused no casualties and that its own "artillery struck the sources of fire".

title: Romania to send Patriot system to Ukraine as Russia pounds its power grid
message:
NATO member Romania has announced it will send a Patriot missile system to Ukraine, which has repeatedly called on its allies to increase their air defence support as Russia attacks its energy infrastructure.
Russia fired nine missiles and launched 27 Shahed drones at energy facilities and critical infrastructure in central and eastern Ukraine, the Ukrainian air force said.
The attack hit power structures in the Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv and Vinnytsia regions of Ukraine, causing “extensive damage”, according to the national power company Ukrenergo.
The overnight drone attacks were carried out by Ukraine’s Security Service, known by its acronym SBU, a Kyiv security official told The Associated Press news agency.
Russia’s Ministry of Defence said air defences downed 15 Ukrainian drones over three regions but did not mention any damage.
event_breakdown: The current event of security that can be placed on a map is a missile attack by Russian forces on critical infrastructure in Ukraine. The missiles hit power structures in Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv and Vinnytsia regions of Ukraine. The Russian Ministry of Defence denied any involvement in the attack, but Ukraine's Security Service said the attack was carried out by two helicopters.

title: Fighting in Gaza Rafah as tensions soar on Israel - Lebanon border
message:
Fighting in Gaza's Rafah as tensions soar on Israel-Lebanon borderWorld World Fighting in Gaza's Rafah as tensions soar on Israel-Lebanon borderIsraeli air strikes and clashes between troops and Palestinian groups rocked Gaza on Wednesday.
The Israeli military, which has traded near-daily cross-border fire with Lebanon's Hezbollah since October, said late Tuesday that "operational plans for an offensive in Lebanon were approved and validated".
Witnesses reported seeing Israeli military vehicles enter the city's neighbourhood of Saudi, followed by nighttime gun battles.
Parts of central Gaza also experienced fighting overnight, while witnesses reported artillery shelling and heavy gunfire in northern Gaza City's Zeitun neighbourhood.
A UN report issued Wednesday detailed six "indiscriminate and disproportionate" Israeli strikes that killed at least 218 people in the first two months of the war.

title: Attack on army base fuels Burkina Faso mutiny rumours
message:
The leader of the military junta has since appeared on state TV in an attempt to debunk the rumours.
Burkina Faso has been battling Islamist insurgents for several years and about half the country is outside government control.
Commenting for the first time since the attack, Capt Ibrahim Traoré said the military had launched an operation after the attack, and sent reinforcement troops.
But Capt Traoré denied reports of mutiny within the army.
Local media outlets in Burkina Faso have downplayed the RTB incident and the Mansila attack, perhaps over fears of a crackdown.

title: Fire at oil depots in 2 Russian regions after overnight drone attacks
message:
Fire at oil depots in 2 Russian regions after overnight drone attacksDrone attacks caused fires overnight on June 20 at oil depots in Russia's Republic of Adygea and Tambov Oblast, Russian authorities claimed.
Russian Telegram channels shared videos showing burning oil depots and rising smoke.
Drones operated by the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) hit two oil depots in Russia's Rostov Oblast overnight on June 18, a source in security and defense forces told the Kyiv Independent.
Overall, the SBU carried out 20 successful attacks against Russian oil industry facilities in various regions, the source said.

title: Russia obliterates front - line Ukraine towns by retrofitting bombs and expanding its air base network – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
KHARKIV, Ukraine (AP) — The first shock wave shattered aisles stacked almost to the ceiling with home improvement products.
The next Russian bomb streaked down like a comet seconds later, unleashing flames that left the megastore an ashen shell.
Store manager Oleksandr Lutsenko walks inside the Epicenter shopping complex in Kharkiv, Ukraine, Thursday, June 6, 2024.
The bombing of the Epicenter with glide bombs by the Russian military in May killed 19 people, including two children.
Photos on Russian Telegram channels linked to the military show glide bombs being launched three and four at a time.

The Russian military bombed the Epicenter shopping complex in Kharkiv, Ukraine, killing 19 people, including two children.

title: IDF Eliminates Hamas Sniper Commander In Northern Gaza
message:
An Israeli aircraft killed the Hamas terrorist Ahmed Hassan Salmi al-Sawarka in the Beit Hanoun area of the northern Gaza Strip, according to a statement.
Al-Sawarka served as a squad commander in the terrorist organization's elite Nukhba force and raided Israeli communities on October 7.
In addition, he led and directed Hamas snipers in the area and took part in operations against IDF forces.
Before the strike, the IDF said it took measures to prevent harm to civilians, and no civilians were harmed.
For more stories on the Israel Hamas war, click hereRead more updates as they come in from the conflict

It was the third such test from Gaza since an 11-day battle between Israel and Palestinian militant groups in Gaza last month.

title: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah warns Israel about the cost of a war in Lebanon
message:
BEIRUT — As fighting along the Lebanese-Israeli border escalates, Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah is warning Israel that if the conflict were to slide into war, Israeli forces would face a much more powerful enemy than in the past.
Nasrallah as well repeated that Hezbollah did not want war, but that the current fighting risked sliding into a much wider battle.
Nasrallah said that in previous wars with Israel, Hezbollah had only hoped of being able to strike Israel’s Meron air base — the center for its northern Israel operations command.
Hezbollah fought another war with Israel in 2006.
Nasrallah said Cyprus allowing its bases to be used to target Lebanon would make it “part of the war, and the resistance will deal with it as part of the war."

BEIRUT, Lebanon — Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah is warning that the conflict along the Lebanese-Israeli border risks sliding into war.

Nasrallah said that in a new interview with Germany’s ARD television on Monday that Israel would be mistaken to underestimate the capabilities of the “Islamic resistance” if a war erupted, and that Israel would face a more powerful enemy than in past wars.

He also said that in previous wars with Israel Hezbollah had only hoped to be able to strike Israel’s Meron air base — the center for its northern Israel operations command — and that this would likely be impossible in a future war.

Nasrallah also said that Cyprus allowing its bases to be used to target Lebanon would make it “part of the war, and the resistance will deal with it as part of the war."

Nasrallah also repeated that Hezbollah did not want war, but warned that the current fighting risked sliding into a much wider battle.

title: The leader of Lebanon Hezbollah militant group warns archenemy Israel against wider war
message:
The leader of Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group warns archenemy Israel against wider warBEIRUT (AP) — Lebanon’s Hezbollah has new weapons and intelligence capabilities that could help it target more critical positions deeper inside Israel in case of an all-out war, the militant group's leader warned on Wednesday.
Israel views Hezbollah as its most direct threat, and the two fought a 34-day war in 2006 that ended in a stalemate.
Hezbollah said at least four of its fighters were killed in Israeli strikes on Wednesday as Hochstein returned to Israel for a new round of meetings there.
The Israeli military said two Hezbollah launches damaged several vehicles in northern Israel.
Israeli strikes have killed more than 400 people in Lebanon, most of them Hezbollah and other militants, but also over 80 civilians and non-combatants.
event_breakdown: Lebanon's Hezbollah has new weapons and intelligence capabilities that could help it target more critical positions deeper inside Israel, said the secretary-general of Lebanon's Hezbollah on Wednesday as he returned to Beirut from a visit to Israel. The Israeli military said at least two Hezbollah-launched missiles damaged oil fields in northern Israel on Wednesday. Hezbollah also held a news conference in Beirut later Wednesday, saying Israeli airstrikes had killed four of its fighters and warning Israel against further attacks. The Israeli military said two Hezbollah-assails missiles injured several vehicles in northern Israel. Hezbollah denied TV reports on its fatalities.

title: Russian air attack damages Ukraine energy infrastructure – The Irish Times
message:
Russian drone and missile strikes damaged energy infrastructure across Ukraine on Thursday in the latest big attack on the country’s civilian energy system, the Ukrainian energy ministry said.
The energy ministry said the attack injured three workers at one energy facility and cut power for some consumers.
Ukrainian energy firm DTEK said that one of its thermal power plants had also been seriously damaged.
Kyiv says Russian drone and missile strikes on Ukraine's energy infrastructure this spring have knocked out half the country's power generating capacity and forced rolling blackouts.
Russia says energy infrastructure is a legitimate military target and denies targeting civilians or civilian infrastructure.

title: Russia new deadly three - tonne bomb causing chaos on Ukraine frontlines
message:
Russia's army launched a surprise attack in Ukraine's northeast in early May, initially making rapid progress.
However, the offensive has become bogged down amid fierce resistance from Ukrainian forces, who have recaptured territory from Putin's army.
In recent days, the Russian army dropped a gigantic three-ton bomb known as the FAB-3000 on a building block in the village of Lyptsi.
Images afterwards reveal the building sustained massive damages from the attack and was reduced to a shell of its former self.
The bomb fell about ten metres from the building but had a lethal radius of 230 metres.
event_breakdown:
Russia dropped a gigantic three-ton bomb on a building in Ukraine's northeast
Russia's army dropped a gigantic three-ton bomb known as the FAB-3000 on a building block in the village of Lyptsi in Ukraine's northeast. The attack substantially damaged the building.

title: Russian air attack damages Ukraine energy infrastructure
message:
The attack on energy infrastructure in four regions damaged equipment, wounded seven workers and cut off electricity to more than 218,000 consumers, the energy ministry said.
The attacks, Kyiv says, have knocked out half of Ukraine's energy generating capacity since March and forced rolling blackouts.
Officials in Kyiv have for months been appealing to Ukraine's allies to supply more air defences against the air strikes carried out by Russia throughout the nearly 28-month-old full-scale invasion.
The Ukrainian air force said it shot down five out of nine missiles and all 27 drones launched by Russia over 10 Ukrainian regions during Thursday's attack.
Private power company DTEK said one of its thermal power plants suffered significant damage during what it said was the seventh large-scale attack on its infrastructure since March 22.

title: 3 IS militants killed in airstrikes in Iraq
message:
Baghdad, June 20 : Three Islamic State (IS) militants were killed on Thursday in airstrikes in the northern province of Kirkuk, the Iraqi military said.
The warplanes carried out another airstrike on the nearby caves and tunnels used by the militants, Xinhua news agency reported.
A source in the Iraqi army told Xinhua on condition of anonymity that a force from Kirkuk Operations Command was dispatched to the scene to search the attacked sites.
The security situation in Iraq has improved since the defeat of the IS in 2017.
However, IS remnants have sneaked into the urban centres, deserts, and rugged areas, carrying out frequent guerilla attacks against security forces and civilians.

title: Lebanon affirms strong ties with Cyprus
message:
Beirut, June 21 : The Lebanese-Cypriot ties are strong, said the Lebanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Emigrants, a day after Hezbollah Leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah threatened to wage a war against Cyprus.
"The Lebanese-Cypriot relations are based on a rich history of diplomatic cooperation; also, bilateral communication and consultation are ongoing at the highest levels between the two countries to discuss issues of common interest," the Ministry added on Thursday.
The Ministry's statement comes a day after Nasrallah threatened to wage war against Cyprus if the latter allows Israel to use its airports in the event of a war with Hezbollah, Xinhua news agency reported.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on October 8, 2023, following a barrage of rockets launched by the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah toward Israel in solidarity with Hamas' attack on Israel on October 7.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.

title: Israel may have violated laws of war in Gaza , UN rights office says
message:
GENEVA - Israeli forces may have repeatedly violated fundamental principles of the laws of war and failed to distinguish between civilians and fighters in their Gaza Strip military campaign, the United Nations human rights office said on June 19.
In a report assessing six Israeli attacks that caused a high number of casualties and destruction of civilian infrastructure, the UN human rights office said Israeli forces "may have systematically violated the principles of distinction, proportionality and precautions in attack".
Israel's air and ground offensive has killed more than 37,400 people in Gaza, according to the health authorities there.
Last week, the UN human rights office said the killing of civilians during an Israeli operation to free four hostages could amount to war crimes, but so might Palestinian militants' holding of captives in densely populated areas.
ALSO READ: UN human rights chief: Situation in West Bank 'drastically deteriorating'
event_breakdown: On June 19, 2023, the UN human rights office accused Israeli forces of committing another war crime by launching a military attack on civilian infrastructure in the Gaza city of Khan Younis. In addition, the human rights office said that Israeli forces may have repeatedly violated fundamental principles of the laws of war and failed to distinguish between civilians and fighters during the Gaza military campaign.

title: Russia Pounds Ukrainian Energy Sites in Latest Attacks
message:
A Russian missile and drone barrage damaged a Ukrainian power plant and other energy facilities overnight, officials said on Thursday, the latest in a series of strikes that have pushed the country's grid to the brink.
The targeted aerial barrages over recent months have crippled Ukraine's electricity generation capacity and forced officials to impose rolling blackouts and import supplies from neighboring EU states.
"The enemy attacked a number of energy infrastructure facilities," the energy ministry said, adding that the barrage of Russian projectiles targeted energy-linked sites in four regions, including the capital, without elaborating.
DTEK, Ukraine's largest private energy company, said the aerial attacks had caused "serious damage" at one of its thermal power plants, and that three of its employees had been wounded in the attack.
"This is already the seventh mass attack on the company's thermal power plant in the last three months," the company said.

The agreement with Japan would give Ukraine $4.5bn in military, humanitarian and financial aid this year alone, he said.
The nature of that safeguard would be to protect Ukraine against changes of government and rein in alliance outliers like Hungary, which has refused to provide military aid to Kyiv’s forces.

title: Russia Targets Ukrainian Power System Overnight in New Barrage
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Ukraine said Russia targeted energy facilities overnight as President Vladimir Putin’s forces continue attacks to disrupt the country’s power system.
DTEK, the country’s largest non-state power producer, said three workers were wounded in the barrage, which did serious damage to a thermal power plant.
Five out of nine missiles launched by Russia overnight were downed, as were all 27 explosive-laden drones, Air Force commander Mykola Oleshchuk said.
The overnight drone attack against Russian facilities was organized by the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU), an official with the knowledge of the operation said.
(Updates with information on grid damage, SBU drone attack)Most Read from Bloomberg Businessweek©2024 Bloomberg L.P.

The attack caused three workers to be wounded. Ukraine also reported that five out of nine missiles launched by Russia were downed, as were all 27 explosive-laden drones. Additionally, the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) organized a drone attack against Russian facilities during the night.

title: Russia Targets Ukraine Power Grid
message:
Russia destroyed and damaged Ukrainian energy facilities overnight as President Vladimir Putin’s forces continue attacks to disrupt the country’s power system.
DTEK, the country’s largest power producer, said three workers were wounded in the barrage, which did serious damage to one of its thermal power plants.
This was the seventh attack against the company’s power plants over the past three months, DTEK said on Telegram.
Russia said the Ukrainian military also launched drone attacks overnight against its territory.
Tambov governor Maksim Yegorov said that a presumed drone attack lit a fuel reservoir in the region on fire.
event_breakdown: Russia-Ukraine conflict: Russia attacked and destroyed Ukrainian energy production facilities overnight, wounding three workers. The attacks are part of Russia's campaign to disrupt the country's power supply.

GRAND ISLAND, Neb.
(AP) — Witnesses say they heard an Ohio man demand the keys to a Jeep that was being towed behind a Missouri couple's RV before he brutally stabbed them both and killed the man at an Interstate 80 rest area.
James Thompson Jr., 22, was formally charged with first-degree murder and 10 other felonies Thursday morning — a day after the attack at a rest area just outside Grand Island in eastern Nebraska.
The 72-year-old died later at a Grand Island hospital.
Thompson fled the rest area in a Ford Focus before officers arrived, but a Nebraska State Trooper quickly spotted him exiting the highway at Wood River.

title: Terrorist who killed German police officer has  no regret after waking from coma | World | News
message:
A 25-year-old terrorist who fatally stabbed a German police officer last month has expressed no regrets after regaining consciousness from an induced coma.
Sulaiman Ataee brutally attacked 29-year-old officer Rouven Laur during an anti-Islam rally in Mannheim on May 31, repeatedly stabbing him in the head and neck.
Ataee, a radical Islamist, was captured on video brandishing a knife and lunging at far-right activist Michael Stürzenberger and four bystanders before targeting Officer Laur.
The officer was rushed to the hospital for emergency surgery but succumbed to his injuries two days later.
Initial reports suggested Ataee had died during his apprehension by police, but it was later confirmed that he survived and had been in a coma at Theresienkrankenhaus hospital in Mannheim.

title: Vladimir Putin arrives in Vietnam for his final stop on a two - nation Asia tour
message:
Vladimir Putin has arrived in Vietnam for discussions with its communist leaders as part of his tour of Asia.
Upon arrival at Hanoi airport, the Russian president was greeted by Vietnamese deputy prime minister Tran Hong Ha among other party diplomats.
Putin's visit to Vietnam follows a high-profile trip to Pyongyang, where he and Kim Jong-un signed a mutual defense agreement.
The visit has sparked criticism from the US, one of Vietnam's key trade partners, who have expressed concerns about Russia's disregard for international law.
This marks Putin's fifth visit to Vietnam as president, highlighting the longstanding partnership between Moscow and Hanoi since the Soviet era.

message:
Russian drone attacks in the early hours of June 20 damaged energy infrastructure in Vinnytsia, Kyiv, Dnipropetrovsk, and Donetsk oblasts, reported state-owned energy operator Ukrenergo.
At least three people - men aged 30, 41, and 63 - were injured overnight in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, according to regional governor Serhii Lysak.
Russia's attack on the Nikopol district of Dnipropetrovsk Oblast also damaged seven private residences, five warehouses, cars, and power lines.
Russian troops also attacked one of DTEK's, Ukraine's largest private energy company's, thermal power plants, "severely" damaging the equipment, the company said.
Russia used at least nine missiles and 27 drones to target Ukraine, according to the Air Force's morning update.

title: South Korean troops fire more warning shots at border
message:
Meanwhile, an activists’ group said it flew more balloons carrying propaganda leaflets toward North Korea, continuing a campaign that has aggravated animosities between the rivals and prompted a resumption of Cold War-style psychological warfare along their border.
The intrusions are likely related to the large number of troops North Korea has been deploying in frontline areas to fortify their side of the border, possibly to prevent civilians and soldiers from defecting to the South, as Pyongyang’s leadership continues to tighten its grip over the population.
South Korea has recently retaliated for North Korea’s trash-carrying balloon launches with propaganda loudspeaker broadcasts at border areas (South Korea Defence Ministry via AP, File)The South Korean civilian activists, led by North Korean defector Park Sang-hak, said it floated 20 balloons attached with 300,000 propaganda leaflets, 5,000 USB sticks with South Korean pop songs and TV dramas, and 3,000 US dollar bills from the South Korean border town of Paju on Thursday night.
Analysts say Pyongyang resents such material and fears it could demoralise frontline troops and residents and weaken leader Kim Jong Un’s grip on power.
After previous leafletting by Mr Park’s group and other South Korean activists, North Korea launched more than 1,000 balloons that dropped rubbish in South Korea, smashing roof tiles and windows and causing other property damage.
event_breakdown: North Korea is fortifying its border with South Korea to prevent civilians and soldiers from defecting to the South, and South Korea has said it has retaliated by resuming propaganda loudspeaker broadcasts in border areas.

According to RFI, the head of the military junta, General Moussa Traoré, was appointed as prime minister.
Ypres - A new government led by the transition president Daouda Camara took over yesterday. The junta leader Capt Fulbert Diallo, who continued after the resignation of General Amadou Toumani Touré, was arrested during a controversial August coup.
Daouda Camara, trade unionist for railways and mines, has been called the head of the transition by the special armed group put in place after the coup.
To pave the way towards a more representative government, the National People's Congress is expected to reopen on December 3.

In addition to the transitional President Daouda Camara and the RFI, the RMR appointed former Prime Minister Kadara Kindo and Lieutenant General Gilbert Diarra (minister of finance) as part of the transitional administration.

title: Bondi stabbing : Hero police officer Amy Scott receives bravery award after shooting dead attacker
message:
The police officer who stopped the stabbing massacre at a shopping centre in Sydney's Bondi Junction earlier this year has been awarded for her bravery.
Inspector Amy Scott was the lone officer who confronted and shot dead a knife-wielding Joel Cauchi , who killed six and injured a dozen more, at the Westfield shopping centre on April 13.
﻿Today, she received the Commissioner's Medal of Valour for her actions at a graduation at the police academy in Goulburn.
READ MORE: Amateur kickboxer identified as man killed in alleged road rage attackInspector Amy Scott receives the Commissioner's Valour Award.
NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb said it was her privilege to award Scott with the medal ﻿and certificate.

3.On June 22, Inspector Scott received the Police Commissioner's Medal of Valour for her actions at a graduation at the police academy in Goulburn.

title: Israel - Hezbollah hostilities fan fears of widening Gaza war
message:
Experts are divided on the prospect of a wider war, almost nine months into Israel's campaign to eradicate Hezbollah's ally Hamas, the Palestinian militant group in the Gaza Strip.
Hezbollah and Israeli forces have exchanged near-daily fire since Hamas's October 7 attack on southern Israel triggered the Gaza war, and the bellicose talk has escalated along with the strikes.
Israel's main military backer the United States has sought to discourage any expansion of hostilities along the border.
Israel's retaliatory offensive in Gaza has killed at least 37,431 people, also mostly civilians, according to the health ministry in the Hamas-ruled territory.
On Tuesday, Israel's military announced that "operational plans for an offensive in Lebanon were approved and validated".

Israel - Lebanon border renewed hostilities
Ongoing since Israel's October 7 military operation against Hamas, Hezbollah and Israeli forces have exchanged cross-border fire, and Israel has approved "plans for an offensive in Lebanon."

title: Ukraine Reinforces Embattled Hilltop Town In East
message:
(MENAFN- The Peninsula) AFPKyiv, Ukraine: Ukraine has said is dispatching reinforcements to an embattled strategic hilltop town in the eastern Donetsk region, a vital flashpoint whose capture could accelerate Russian advances deeper in the industrial territory.
Donetsk has borne the brunt of fighting since Russian forces invaded in February 2022, and Ukrainian forces are struggling to hold the line there against better-resourced Russian forces.
The unit had been deployed near the town of Toretsk, another frontline region where Russian forces have gained ground after a lull in fighting there, according to military bloggers.
Chasiv Yar, which had a pre-war population of around 12,000 people, sits above nearby civilian hubs of Kramatorsk and Kostiantynivka.
Separately, authorities in the frontline town of Selydove further south in the Donetsk region said two people had been killed and three more were wounded in a Russian airstrike.

title: Japan - US security ties may heighten tensions in Asia - Pacific , experts warn
message:
[Photo/VCG]Japan and the United States have taken their security relationship to a new height, a move that might both create and escalate tensions in the Asia-Pacific region, experts said.
The US is currently facing a shortage of ammunition, which is largely attributed to its support for Ukraine and Israel, and is also grappling with the challenge of augmenting its Patriot missile production capacity.
Liu Qingbin, a former professor at Yokohama National University's Institute of Advanced Sciences, said the US ambassador is using "China's capacity in shipbuilding as an excuse to build US-Japan military cooperation".
Japanese analysts, however, expressed concerns over Washington using Tokyo as a key partner to boost its own military production.
According to Emanuel, the US ambassador, the meeting of the US-Japan Security Consultative Committee to be held in July is the "deadline" for achieving concrete outcomes in defense industry cooperation.
location: Yokohama National University Institute of Advanced Sciences
event_breakdown: Japan and the United States have recently conducted a joint military exercise, a move aimed at improving the two countries' security relationship. The US has also invited Japan to participate in a joint exercise in the South China Sea.

NSW Police inspector Amy Scott has been hailed a hero for bringing an end to Joel Cauchi's stabbing rampage at Bondi Junction Westfield on 13 April.

title: Ukraine can hit inside Russia  anywhere  its forces attack across border : US
message:
In a shift in stance, the United States has told Ukraine that it can use American-supplied weapons to hit Russian forces "anywhere", its forces attack from across the border, and not just the region near Kharkiv, Politico reported, citing US officials.
On the other hand, Ukraine and other European officials have asked the US to loosen its restrictions, allowing Ukraine to strike anywhere inside Russia.
Recently, Russia has indicated that it might soon move to the northeastern city of Sumy, which is also near the Russian border.
It's about 'common sense', adding that, "If Russia is attacking or about to attack from its territory into Ukraine, it only makes sense to allow Ukraine to hit back against the forces that are hitting it from across the border."
"The president recently directed his team to ensure that Ukraine is able to use US weapons for counter-fire purposes in Kharkiv so Ukraine can hit back at Russian forces hitting them or preparing to hit them," Sullivan said.
event_breakdown: US tells Ukraine it can use American-provided weapons near Kharkiv, Politico, May 26, 2022

title: Israel Pounds Central Gaza Camps , Deepens Invasion of Rafah
message:
In Deir al-Balah, a city packed with displaced people in the central Gaza Strip, an Israeli air strike killed one Palestinian and wounded several others on Thursday, medics said.
Later on Thursday, an Israeli air strike on a house in the Zeitoun neighbourhood in Gaza City killed seven Palestinians, medics said.
Another air strike on a house west of the city killed a journalist of the Hamas-run Al-Aqsa TV, Hamas media said.
Rafah housed over half of Gaza's 2.3 million people until 7 May when Israeli forces began the ground offensive into the city.
The freed detainees were admitted into Al-Aqsa Hospital in Deir Al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip after they complained of torture and mistreatment by Israeli jailers.

title: Once ousted as Haiti police chief for failing to control gangs , he now back in top job
message:
Rameau Normil had served as acting director of the Haiti National Police for 15 months before he was fired by former President Jovenel Moïse in November 2020.
Rameau Normil, who previously served as acting director of the Haiti National Police for 15 months, has been tapped as police chief after his predecessor was ousted.
On Friday, the U.N. Security Council has scheduled a. briefing for an update on where the deployment stands.
As head of the national police he faced criticism over his failure to thwart Moïse’s assassination and guarantee the safety of Prime Minister Ariel Henry.
Haiti Prime Minister Garry Conille on Tuesday, June 18, 2024 welcomes 455 newly trained specialized police officers in a ceremony at the National Police Academy in Port-au-Prince.

title: South Korean troops fire more warning shots at border
message:
South Korea’s military said it had fired warning shots to repel North Korean soldiers who temporarily crossed the rivals’ land border for the third time this month.
The intrusions are likely related to the large number of troops North Korea has been deploying in frontline areas to fortify their side of the border, possibly to prevent civilians and soldiers from defecting to the South, as Pyongyang’s leadership continues to tighten its grip over the population.
South Korea has recently retaliated for North Korea’s trash-carrying balloon launches with propaganda loudspeaker broadcasts at border areas (South Korea Defence Ministry via AP, File)The South Korean civilian activists, led by North Korean defector Park Sang-hak, said it floated 20 balloons attached with 300,000 propaganda leaflets, 5,000 USB sticks with South Korean pop songs and TV dramas, and 3,000 US dollar bills from the South Korean border town of Paju on Thursday night.
Analysts say Pyongyang resents such material and fears it could demoralise frontline troops and residents and weaken leader Kim Jong Un’s grip on power.
After previous leafletting by Mr Park’s group and other South Korean activists, North Korea launched more than 1,000 balloons that dropped rubbish in South Korea, smashing roof tiles and windows and causing other property damage.

title: Electronic Weapons : SpaceX Stifles Russian Use of Starlink
message:
June 20, 2024: Ukrainian forces have been supplied with SpaceX Starlink satellite communication terminals since the beginning of the Russian invasion.
SpaceX allowed Ukrainian forces to use Starlink terminals free of charge and as of 2024 about 10,000 Starlink terminals are used in Ukraine by the military, government and some commercial enterprises.
Maintaining the level of Starlink service Ukraine demands to maintain its communications advantage over Russia keeps growing.
Starlink officials had already been negotiating with Ukraine to provide Starlink service locally.
Starlink also responded by modifying the design of newly manufactured Starlink satellites to resist efforts to disrupt service.
event_breakdown:
SpaceX supplies Ukrainian forces with Starlink satellite communication terminals, free of charge, and Ukraine has ordered 33,000 more after the Russian invasion disrupted communications.

Keeping the level of Starlink service Ukrainians demand to maintain its communications advantage over Russia required SpaceX to adapt newly manufactured Starlink satellites to better resist efforts to disrupt the service. Ukrainian Starlink usage within this year went so high about 10,000 terminals is used.

title: IDF announces names of two fallen soldiers - The Jerusalem Post
message:
The IDF announced on Friday the names of two soldiers who were killed in battle in the Gaza Strip from mortar fire.
Omer Smadga, 25, from Ganot Hadar, from the 9203 Battalion in the Alexandroni Brigade, fell in combat in the central Gaza Strip.
Saadia Yaakov Dery, 27, from Tel Aviv, from the 9203 Battalion in the Alexandroni Brigade, fell in combat in the central Gaza Strip.
The evacuation of the injured was complicated, with IDF soldiers firing heavily towards the area where the terrorists launched the mortars.
IDF medical teams provided quick initial treatment and evacuated the injured soldiers using 669 helicopters to hospitals in central Israel.

Dery was studying for rabbinical exams before he was drafted on October 7 for reserves.

message:

title: Chad : Explosion at military arms depot kills nine , injures 46
message:
CNN —A massive explosion on Tuesday evening near Chad’s capital city of N’Djamena killed at least nine and injured 46 others, according to a statement from its foreign minister.
Video authenticated and geolocated to the international airport in N’Djamena shows a massive fireball and sparks rising in the night sky.
Satellite imagery from Maxar Technologies shows that 17 structures at the ammo depot were destroyed.
In the satellite image, the structures destroyed in the explosion were spread out, and in two groups that were at opposite ends of the complex.
Chad’s president Mahamat Idriss Deby Itno said that an investigation will be conducted into the cause of the fire at the ammunition depot.

title: Ukraine Kharkiv has withstood Russia relentless strikes . Locals fear what next
message:
KHARKIV, Ukraine — In Ukraine’s second-largest city, May was the toughest month on record since Russia’s full-scale invasion more than two years ago.
On May 25, Russian forces hit a home improvement shopping center in the Kharkiv neighborhood of Saltivka, killing 19 people, including two children.
Kharkiv’s mayor, Ihor Terekhov, said Russian forces attacked the city 76 times last month — three times more than the previous month.
Especially terrifying were the use of guided bombs, which Russian forces had been launching on the eastern front line to break through Ukrainian defenses.

title: Ukraine Kharkiv has withstood Russia relentless strikes . Locals fear what next
message:
KHARKIV, Ukraine — In Ukraine’s second-largest city, May was the toughest month on record since Russia’s full-scale invasion more than two years ago.
On May 25, Russian forces hit a home improvement shopping center in the Kharkiv neighborhood of Saltivka, killing 19 people, including two children.
Kharkiv’s mayor, Ihor Terekhov, said Russian forces attacked the city 76 times last month — three times more than the previous month.
Especially terrifying were the use of guided bombs, which Russian forces had been launching on the eastern front line to break through Ukrainian defenses.
Laurel Chor for NPR / People in the Shevchenko City Garden in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on May 31.
event_breakdown:
KHARKIV, Ukraine — Russian forces shelled Ukraine’s second-largest city 76 times last month, the largest number of attacks since Russia’s full-scale invasion of the country more than two years ago, said Kharkiv Mayor Ihor Terekhov.

On Monday, Russian troops hit a shopping center in Kharkiv’s Saltivka neighborhood, killing 19 people, including two children.

Terekhov said the use of guided bombs also increased by three times in eastern Ukraine.

title: Attack on army base fuels Burkina Faso mutiny rumors
message:
The leader of the military junta has since appeared on state TV in an attempt to debunk the rumors.
Burkina Faso has been battling Islamist insurgents for several years and about half the country is outside government control.
But Capt Traoré denied reports of mutiny within the army.
Local media outlets in Burkina Faso have downplayed the RTB incident and the Mansila attack, perhaps over fears of a crackdown.
Capt Traoré has largely kept a low profile since the Mansila attack.
event_breakdown:
1. Burkina Faso: On January 24, 2022, members of the military in Burkina Faso took control of the national television headquarters and radio station in the capital, Ouagadougou. The leader of the military junta, Captain Sidonie Berthe, has since appeared on state TV in an attempt to debunk rumors of a mutiny within the army.
2. Burkina Faso: On the night of January 23, 2022, Islamist insurgents attacked a military barracks in Mansila, northern Togo. The attackers, believed to be affiliated with Al-Qaida, launched an attack on the barracks housing about 400 troops. The siege lasted for several hours before the assailants were repelled.
3. Burkina Faso: On January 20, 2022, armed Islamist insurgents attacked a police station in the northern town of Djibo, killing two officers and taking another prisoner. The militants used explosives and car bombs during the attack, which comes amid increasing tensions in the region.
4. Burkina Faso: On January 14, 2022, armed Islamist militants attacked a prison in the town of Souma, setting fire to buildings and freeing about 100 prisoners. The prison is located near the border with Mali, where Islamist militants have been active for some time. The attack came just days after President Roch Marc Kabore declared a state of emergency in the central and western regions of the country.

title: Cyprus held unofficial talks with Hezbollah , according to Lebanese TV
message:
Cyprus and Hezbollah had unofficial contacts after the Islamist organisation’s leader’s threats against Cyprus, journalist Salem Zahran told the Lebanese channel MTV.
In a televised speech on Wednesday, Hezbollah’s Lebanese leader Hassan Nasrallah threatened Cyprus that they would start considering it as “part of the war” and a target should the island open its airports and bases to Israel.
Zahran explained on MTV that “Hezbollah Secretary General Hassan Nasrallah did not threaten the Cypriots, but rather warned them that Cyprus would be a partner in bombing Lebanon in the event of a war.”The journalist said that there was indirect contact between Cyprus and Hezbollah, where positive messages were conveyed.
Hezbollah is a Lebanese Shia Islamist militant organisation, led since 1992 by Nasrallah.
Known for its close links with Iran, Hezbollah’s political wing, the Loyalty to the Resistance Bloc, is a party in the Lebanese parliament.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah threaten Cyprus. Cyprus Hezbollah had unofficial contacts after leader’s threats.

title: Japan - US security ties may heighten tensions in Asia - Pacific , experts warn
message:
[Photo/VCG]Japan and the United States have taken their security relationship to a new height, a move that might both create and escalate tensions in the Asia-Pacific region, experts said.
The US is currently facing a shortage of ammunition, which is largely attributed to its support for Ukraine and Israel, and is also grappling with the challenge of augmenting its Patriot missile production capacity.
Liu Qingbin, a former professor at Yokohama National University's Institute of Advanced Sciences, said the US ambassador is using "China's capacity in shipbuilding as an excuse to build US-Japan military cooperation".
Japanese analysts, however, expressed concerns over Washington using Tokyo as a key partner to boost its own military production.
According to Emanuel, the US ambassador, the meeting of the US-Japan Security Consultative Committee to be held in July is the "deadline" for achieving concrete outcomes in defense industry cooperation.
event_breakdown: Japan,  United States  - Japan and the United States have taken their security relationship to a new height, a move that might both create and escalate tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Bardia Shojaeifard : Boy , 15 , jailed for murder of Alfie Lewis in knife attack outside school in Leeds
message:
Bardia Shojaeifard was named for the first time today by a judge shortly before he was sentenced for the murder of Alfie Lewis, also 15.
Alfie was stabbed to death in front of pupils leaving a primary school in the Horsforth area of Leeds last November.
The court heard Shojaeifard - who was 14 at the time of the murder - was an "outwardly normal" boy.
Image: Alfie LewisShojaeifard was found guilty of murdering Alfie by a Leeds Crown Court jury in April.
Alfie was stabbed twice - with a chest wound penetrating his heart and causing "catastrophic bleeding", West Yorkshire Police said.

Armenia Recognizes Palestinian State, Malnutrition in Gaza
On Friday, Armenia announced it would recognize a Palestinian state, prompting Israel to summon its ambassador for what the Foreign Ministry described as a “severe reprimand.” According to Ma’an News Agency, dozens of countries have recognized a Palestinian state, however, none of the major Western powers has done so.

In related news, the World Health Organization released a statement on Friday reporting that malnutrition is significantly increasing in the besieged Gaza Strip, with one in three children under five acutely malnourished.

The rise in malnutrition cases among children is thought to be linked to the continuing Israeli blockade of Gaza, as well as the destruction from last year's war between Israel and Hamas.

title: Police search for suspect in fatal Brattleboro stabbing
message:
BRATTLEBORO, Vt. (WCAX) - One man is dead following a stabbing in Brattleboro.
Just before 11 p.m. on Thursday, Brattleboro Police say they responded to 77 Flat Street for a report of a stabbing.
The victim was transported to Brattleboro Memorial Hospital where he was later pronounced dead.
Police say they’ve identified a suspect, but the suspect remains at large.
The identity of the victim has not yet been released and the investigation is ongoing.

title: 2 fatally wounded at 31st Street Beach overnight during exchange of gunfire ; several in custody
message:
Multiple people are in police custody after an exchange of gunfire broke out, fatally wounding two victims overnight near 31st Street Beach, Chicago police said.
Shortly after 3:15 a.m., police responded to a call of a person shot in the 3100 block of South DuSable Lake Shore Drive and found a man, 23, and a woman, 22, shot multiple times.
Both were pronounced dead at the scene, police said.
A preliminary investigation revealed the man was exchanging gunfire with multiple people who were on the scene.
The fatal attack is the second time in recent days where a fatal shooting has happened in the area of 31st Street Beach.

title: Israeli Army Confirms Killing Of Senior Hamas Commander In Gaza
message:
More than 37,000 people have been killed in Gaza since the war broke out last year in October.
The Israeli army has confirmed the killing of a Hamas commander in an airstrike in the town of Beit Hanoun in the northern Gaza Strip.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said on Thursday that IDF troops are continuing to operate in the central Gaza Strip and the southern Rafah area, Xinhua news agency reported.
The health authorities in Gaza said in a press statement that as of Thursday, the Palestinian death count from Israeli military operations has risen to 37,431 people, with 85,653 others wounded.
Israel launched a large-scale offensive against Hamas in the Gaza Strip to retaliate against a Hamas rampage through the southern Israeli border on October 7, 2023, during which about 1,200 people were killed and around 250 were taken hostage.

title: Uproar over Dem push to draft women for the military | WND
message:
Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Missouri, described the requirement for women to sign up for the draft "insane."
First, the House has voted to allow automatic registration, without the consent of individuals, for Selective Service between the ages of 18 and 26.
Controversially, the Senate version of the proposed legislation would require women to present themselves as potentially eligible for a military draft.
"This is a stark departure from historical norms," Spears told WND, questioning what this might entail for young women.
What's more, he declared, "Drafting women for service to overseas adventurism that has little to do with American national defense is an immoral proposition.

title: Stabbing suspect arrested following similar incident | News
message:
Editor's Note: This online story initially wrongly indicated that the arrested suspect was implicated in an unrelated June 18 stabbing.
The suspect allegedly responsible for the Monday night shooting and stabbing has been arrested following a similar, violent incident Thursday night in downtown Colorado Springs, according to the Colorado Springs Police Department.
Police said at approximately 10:55 p.m., officers received multiple reports of a stabbing outside of a business near the intersection of East Cimarron Street and South Tejon Street.
Following a search of the area, police discovered the suspect near the area of Colorado Avenue and Antlers Place.
Police said after arresting the suspect investigators were able to confirm the suspect to also be the suspect in a stabbing in the 00 block of North Tejon Street on June 9, that resulted in one victim with serious injuries.

title: Kyiv Says Suspects of Kazakh Activist Shooting Fled Ukraine
message:
Ukraine said Friday it had identified two suspects in the attempted murder of a Kazakh opposition figure in Kyiv and that the perpetrators had escaped to neighboring Moldova.
Police in Ukraine's capital said this week that a prominent Kazakh anti-government activist, Aydos Sadykov, had been shot and seriously wounded outside his home.
“Two men carefully planned the murder of a journalist,” the office of the prosecutor general in Ukraine said in a statement, adding the suspects were both Kazakh citizens.
Advertisement“The suspects left the territory of Ukraine on the day of the attempted murder, crossing the border of Ukraine and Moldova,” the statement said, adding that both suspects are on an international wanted list.
Tokayev has instructed Kazakh law enforcement agencies to cooperate with Ukraine to locate the suspects, his spokesperson said, according to Russian news agencies.

Event 1:
Date- June 24, 2022
Event Type-Shooting

title: Chad : Explosion at military arms depot kills nine , injures 46
message:
CNN —A massive explosion on Tuesday evening near Chad’s capital city of N’Djamena killed at least nine and injured 46 others, according to a statement from its foreign minister.
Video authenticated and geolocated to the international airport in N’Djamena shows a massive fireball and sparks rising in the night sky.
Satellite imagery from Maxar Technologies shows that 17 structures at the ammo depot were destroyed.
In the satellite image, the structures destroyed in the explosion were spread out, and in two groups that were at opposite ends of the complex.
Chad’s president Mahamat Idriss Deby Itno said that an investigation will be conducted into the cause of the fire at the ammunition depot.
event_breakdown: N'Djamena, the capital city of Chad, experienced a major explosion on Tuesday, killing nine and injuring 46 others. The explosion happened near the international airport and sent a massive fireball into the sky. According to CNN, President Mahamat Idriss Deby Itno said that an investigation will be conducted to determine the cause of the fire that led to the explosion.

title: Al Jazeera English Fault Lines premieres documentary on attacks on civilians in Gaza
message:
The PeninsulaDoha: Today, Fault Lines, Al Jazeera English’s Emmy and Peabody award-winning documentary program, is premiering The Night Won’t End, a ground-breaking, feature-length documentary.
The Salem FamilyThe Night Won’t End investigates a series of airstrikes on December 11 that killed more than 100 people in the Sheikh Radwan neighbourhood of Gaza City.
Fault Lines worked with Airwars, a nonprofit that investigates civilian harm, to examine the attack.
Airwars found that nearly all of the victims were members of the Salem family, including an estimated 50 children.
Our team on the ground in Gaza filmed with members of the Salem family - a mother and her children - over the course of several weeks.
location: The main event takes place in Sheikh Radwan, a neighbourhood of Gaza City.
event_breakdown: Al Jazeera English’s Emmy and Peabody award-winning documentary program, Fault Lines, is premiering a ground-breaking, feature-length documentary called The Night Won’t End. The documentary investigates a series of airstrikes that killed more than 100 people in a neighbourhood in Gaza City on December 11. The film tells the story of a mother and her children – members of the Salem family, which lost fifty children in the attacks – and their attempts to rebuild.

title: Police : 2 arrested after shot fired into occupied vehicle in Virginia Beach
message:
VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. (WAVY) — Two people were arrested after shooting into an occupied vehicle last week in Virginia Beach, police say.
Virginia Beach police say they were tipped about the shooting via a ShotSpotter alert, as well as the person inside the vehicle.
Police were able to identify two suspects in the case, 37-year-old Virginia Beach resident Deondris Caine and 39-year-old Virginia Beach resident Tyisha Davis, and they were both arrested on June 13.
Dondris Cain (Courtesy of Virginia Beach PD)Cain is charged with attempted malicious wounding, four counts of conspiracy, maliciously throwing missile at an occupied vehicle, use of a firearm in the commission of a felony and possession of a firearm by a felon.
Davis is charged with maliciously shooting at an occupied vehicle and conspiracy.

Especially terrifying were the use of guided bombs, which Russian forces had been launching on the eastern front line to break through Ukrainian defenses.

title: Kyiv says suspects of Kazakh activist shooting fled Ukraine
message:
KYIV (AFP): Ukraine said Friday it had identified two suspects in the attempted murder of a Kazakh opposition figure in Kyiv and that the perpetrators had escaped to neighboring Moldova.
Police in Ukraine’s capital said this week that a prominent Kazakh anti-government activist, Aydos Sadykov, had been shot and seriously wounded outside his home.
“Two men carefully planned the murder of a journalist,” the office of the prosecutor general in Ukraine said in a statement, adding the suspects were both Kazakh citizens.
“The suspects left the territory of Ukraine on the day of the attempted murder, crossing the border of Ukraine and Moldova,” the statement said, adding that both suspects are on an international wanted list.
Tokayev has instructed Kazakh law enforcement agencies to cooperate with Ukraine to locate the suspects, his spokesperson said, according to Russian news agencies.

message:
Experts are divided on the prospect of a wider war, almost nine months into Israel’s campaign to eradicate Hezbollah’s ally Hamas, the Palestinian militant group in the Gaza Strip.
Hezbollah and Israeli forces have exchanged near-daily fire since Hamas’s October 7 attack on southern Israel triggered the Gaza war, and the bellicose talk has escalated along with the strikes.
Israel’s main military backer the United States has sought to discourage any expansion of hostilities along the border.
In a televised address on Wednesday, Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah had warned “no place” in Israel would “be spared our rockets” if a wider war began.
Israel’s retaliatory offensive in Gaza has killed at least 37,431 people, also mostly civilians, according to the health ministry in the Hamas-ruled territory.

1. Stabbing reported at a home near Garrett Road in Silver Creek Township, Michigan (USA) at approximately 10:40 p.m. on Thursday, August 8, 2019.
2. John Coons is wanted as a suspect in connection with the stabbing.

title: Israeli forces step up bombardment across Gaza
message:
"Last night was one of the worst nights in western Rafah, drones, planes, tanks, and naval boats bombarded the area.
We feel the occupation is trying to complete the control of the city," said Hatem, 45, reached by text message.
"The entire city of Rafah is an area of Israeli military operations," Ahmed Al-Sofi, the mayor of Rafah, said in a statement carried by Hamas media on Friday.
There was no Israeli immediate comment on the Hamas claim.In nearby Khan Younis, an Israeli air strike on Friday killed three people, including a father and son, medics said.In parallel, Israeli forces continued a new push back into some Gaza City suburbs in the north of the enclave, where they fought with Hamas-led fighters.
Residents said the army forces had destroyed many homes in the heart of Gaza City on Thursday.Later on Friday, an Israeli air strike on a facility of the Gaza City municiplaity killed five people, including four municipality workers, the territory's Civil Emergency Service said.

title: Israeli strikes on tent camps near Rafah kill at least 25 and wound 50 , Gaza health officials say
message:
FILE - Palestinians buy supplies at the market in Rafah, Gaza Strip, on Feb. 18, 2024.
(AP Photo/Fatima Shbair, File)DEIR EL-BALAH – Israeli forces shelled tent camps for displaced Palestinians north of Gaza's southern city of Rafah on Friday, killing at least 25 people and wounding another 50, according to the territory's Heath Ministry and emergency workers.
At least 10 Palestinians were killed by Israeli fire elsewhere in the Gaza Strip on Friday.
The top United Nations court has concluded there is a “plausible risk of genocide” in Gaza — a charge Israel strongly denies.
Israel launched the war after Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack, in which militants stormed into southern Israel, killed some 1,200 people — mostly civilians — and abducted about 250.
event_breakdown: Israeli military offensive on Gaza Strip continues as new wave of airstrikes hits Gaza; at least 25 killed; at least 10 killed; claims Hamas is using civilians as human shields; more than 2,000 rockets fired at Israel in three days; 58 Palestinians have died in the conflict, including 56 civilians and two militants; Israel has lost 3 civilians to the rocket fire, including a child; Israel has begun to target the homes, offices, and vehicles of top Hamas leaders

title: Syracuse man arrested in Fulton for early morning stabbing of woman
message:
A man has been arrested for stabbing a woman in Fulton in the early hours of Friday.
Fulton Police officers were dispatched to the 500 block of South First Street in Fulton at approximately 1:30 a.m. Friday for a reported stabbing.
Upon arrival, a male suspect was pointed out by witnesses as having just stabbed a woman.
Timothy E. Lando, 22, of Syracuse, was arrested for the stabbing.
He was charged with two counts of assault in the first degree (Class B felony) and one count of criminal possession of a weapon in the fourth degree (Class A misdemeanor).
event_breakdown: Fulton, NY: A man was arrested for stabbing a woman in Fulton, NY on Friday.

title: The truth about the turtle tank
message:
In April, a strange new vehicle rolled onto the battlefield in eastern Ukraine.
The new vehicle, dubbed “the turtle tank”, initially had just a metal shell to protect them from drones.
This week, Ukraine captured one of these tanks.
It should prove useful in knowing exactly what’s in them and where their weak spots lie.
Whatever that looks like, one thing we’ve learnt is that these tanks are a very particular solution to a very particular problem.
event_breakdown:
Ukraine captures a Russian-built tank
Metal shells being put on vehicles as protection against drones

title: Upgrades to keep the US military oldest bombers its B - 52s flying for a century are running into delays and rising costs , watchdog finds
message:
Upgrades to keep the US military's oldest bombers — its B-52s — flying for a century are running into delays and rising costs, watchdog findsTwo significant upgrades to the B-52 bombers are facing issues and delays, per a new watchdog report.
The upgrades are part of a plan to keep the B-52s in service until at least 2050.
That's three years later than the Air Force planned to have the re-engined planes operating.
A U.S. Air Force B-52H Stratofortress assigned to the 20th Expeditionary Bomb Squadron at Barksdale Air Force Base, Louisiana, arrives on the flightline August 4, 2023, as part of a Bomber Task Force mission at Andersen Air Force Base, Guam.
The Air Force plans to keep the planes in service until 2050, almost 100 years after the first B-52 entered service.
